intro: Campylanthus yemenensis, commonly known as the Yemen bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
